alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 6:12PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN SHOWERS WILL IMPACT ELBERT...LAURENS...ABBEVILLE AND GREENWOOD COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EST... At 605 PM EST, Regional Doppler radars were tracking a series of showers moving from central Georgia across the lower Piedmont from Elberton to Abbeville to Greenwood to Laurens. Much of this area has already received 1 to 2 inches of rainfall today, and these showers were producing additional rainfall at rates around one-half inch per hour. An additional one-half to one inch of rainfall will be possible in some areas this evening. Standing water in low-lying areas will deepen and additional steady rises to near bankfull are possible on a few creeks and streams. Locations to be impacted include... Greenwood, Laurens, Abbeville, Elberton, Clinton, Ware Shoals, Calhoun Falls, Ninety Six, Joanna and Due West. Heavy rainfall rates in excess of one-half inch per hour are expected and localized minor flooding could develop this evening.
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross any flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly.
